intro: Helietta longifoliata, commonly known as the long-leaved helietta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, evergreen stems that bear small, needle-like leaves arranged in a compact, mat-like form. Its flowers are typically white or pink, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Helietta longifoliata is often found in pine woods and other open, sunny habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
